definition.value: This is an AE which is a common inherited disorder that is characterised by anaemia, jaundice, and splenomegaly.
This is an AE which refers to a type of aplastic anemia affecting the precursors to red blood cells but usually not to white blood cells.
This is an AE which is a type of thrombocytopenic purpura defined as an isolated low platelet count with a normal bone marrow in the absence of other causes of low platelets.
This is an AE which is a rare chronic blood cancer (myeloproliferative neoplasm) characterised by the overproduction of platelets (thrombocytes) by megakaryocytes in the bone marrow.
This is an AE which is the development of thrombocytopenia (a low platelet count), due to the administration of various forms of heparin, an anticoagulant.
This is an AE which is a type of thrombocytopenic purpura defined as an isolated low platelet count with a normal bone marrow in the absence of other causes of low platelets.
This is an AE which is a type of thrombocytopenic purpura defined as an isolated low platelet count with a normal bone marrow in the absence of other causes of low platelets.
This is an AE which is a disease that affects babies in which the platelet count is decreased because the mother's immune system attacks her fetus' or newborn's platelets.
This is an AE which is a medical term meaning that a patient's red blood cells(such as platelet ) are of unequal size.

This is an AE which is a component of blood whose function (along with the coagulation factors) is to react to bleeding from blood vessel injury by clumping, thereby initiating a blood clot and its function is disorder.
This is an AE which is deeply involved in the pathogenesis of psoriasis.
This is an AE which is a condition of high platelet (thrombocyte) count in the blood.
This is an AE which is a condition characterized by abnormally low levels of platelets occurs on the neonatal, also known as thrombocytes, in the blood.
This is an AE which is a condition of high platelet (thrombocyte) count in the blood.

label.value: sickle cell anemia with crisis AE

definition.value: This is an AE which is a crisis disease caused by production of abnormal hemoglobin, which binds with other abnormal hemoglobin molecules within the red blood cell to cause rigid deformation of the cell.
This is an AE which is a group of blood disorders typically inherited from a person's parents.

This is an AE which describes a condition in which a person has one abnormal allele of the hemoglobin beta gene (is heterozygous), but does not display the severe symptoms of sickle cell disease that occur in a person who has two copies of that allele (is homozygous).
This is an AE which is associated with a poor prognosis, and liver transplant is the only definitive management.
This is an AE which is a form of thalassemia involving the genes HBA1 and HBA2.
This is an AE which is without achylia or the Addisonian symptoms of glossitis, flatulent dyspepsia, diarrhoea, paraesthesiae, or neurological symptoms is seen in achrestic anaemia.
This is an AE which is a decrease in the total amount of red blood cells (RBCs) or hemoglobin in the blood or a lowered ability of the blood to carry oxygen.
This is an AE which is any of several types of anaemia characterized by small red blood cells (called microcytes).
This is an AE which is a condition in which red blood cells are unusually small as measured by their mean corpuscular volume.
This is an AE which appear to be the outcome of the impaired production of RBCs.
This is an AE which is a common complication in chronic kidney disease and is associated with many adverse clinical consequences.
This is an AE which may be caused by chronic disease, hemolysis, or bone marrow disorders.
This is an AE which is a disease in which not enough red blood cells are produced due to a deficiency of vitamin B12.
This is an AE which is a cancer of plasma cells, a type of white blood cell that normally produces antibodies.
This is an AE which is one of the most common serious bacterial infections worldwide.
This is an AE which is an inflammatory bone disease that is caused by an infecting microorganism such as staphylococcal and leads to progressive bone destruction and loss.
This is an AE which is a life-threatening condition caused by staphylococcal that arises when the body's response to infection causes injury to its own tissues and organs.
This is an AE which is a family of serious medical conditions relating to an original diagnosis of leukemia.
This is an AE which is a rare condition (1:1,000,000), in which the bones have lesions, inflammation, and pain.
This is an AE which is a rare malignancy affecting megakaryocytes, platelet-producing cells that reside in the bone marrow.
This is an AE which is a type of acute myeloid leukemia. In AML-M5 >80% of the leukemic cells are of monocytic lineage.
This is an AE which is usually associated with determined recurrent cytogenetic aberrations like inv(16), t(v;11) (MLL gene rearrangement), and t(8;16).
This is an AE which is a cancer of plasma cells, a type of white blood cell that normally produces antibodies.
This is an AE which is a subtype of acute myeloid leukemia (AML), a cancer of the white blood cells.
This is an AE which is the transplantation of multipotent hematopoietic stem cells, usually derived from bone marrow, peripheral blood, or umbilical cord blood.
This is an AE which is an uncommon and self-limited syndrome characterized by extremity pain of unknown etiology.
This is an AE which is a type of leukemia affecting myeloid tissue.
This is an AE which is a group of rare blood cancers in which excess red blood cells, white blood cells or platelets are produced in the bone marrow.
This is an AE which occurs in children who are otherwise healthy because of rich blood supply to the growing bones.
This is an AE which is an infection of bone caused by bacterial infection, but rarely can be a fungal infection.
This is an AE which is a form of upper extremity deep vein thrombosis (DVT), a medical condition in which blood clots form in the deep veins of the arms.
This is an AE which is a medical condition that may occur as a long-term complication of deep vein thrombosis (DVT).
This is an AE which is the breakdown (lysis) of blood clots formed in blood vessels, using medication.
This is an AE which is a thrombosis and inflammation of superficial veins which presents as a painful induration with erythema, often in a linear or branching configuration forming cords.
This is an AE which occurs more frequently than thrombosis of one or both umbilical arteries, but poor fetal outcome is more likely with arterial thrombosis.
This is an AE which is a rare surgical complication which may cause serious leg damage and may occasionally be fatal.
